### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE CustomerComplaints (
  complaint_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_name VARCHAR(50),
  complaint_text TEXT,
  status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'Pending',
  resolved_date DATE
)

UPDATE CustomerComplaints SET status='Resolved' WHERE complaint_id = 1;

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE complaints (
    complaint_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id UUID NOT NULL,
    complaint_text TEXT NOT NULL,
    status VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'Open',
    timestamp TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE resolutions (
    resolution_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    complaint_id UUID NOT NULL,
    resolver_id UUID NOT NULL,
    resolution_text TEXT NOT NULL,
    resolution_timestamp TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

### STATEMENT

UPDATE complaints SET status = 'Closed' WHERE complaint_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
